Setup i2cBME680 temp pressure humidity sensor on individual rPis.. connect 3.3, GND, SLA,SLC. It measures Temp, humidity and pressure like eg bme280 and in addition a gas value that is a resistance that chnages with air quality. In clean air the resistance is the highest, if it senses eg VOC gases the resistance becomes lower. airQuality/GasSore is curent resistance / baseline The program can use differnt modes for airQuality/gasScore calibration: - auto calibration: it will run until it finds stable gas resistance and sets that as its basline to be clean air, if the values goes above that baseline it will recalibrate and use the new baseline once calibrated, it will save value to bme680.Calibration file on RPi - or you can overwrite that by setting your own value statically. - or read last calibration from calibration file, if error do regular calibration steps The sensor read rate will impact the baseline, that is due to the heat cycle if you change the read cyle time, it must be recalibrated After some days of running in clean air, proposed setup is: ====set baseline to fixed value of clean air====

MINIMAL setup: Sensor output to a GPIO and ground-- polarity does not matter, connect 12V - polarity does not matter, set mode to medium sensitivity.
For NORMAL -dynamic- setup connect sensor output, and 4 GPIOs to 4 relays to 12V, dipsw 1,2,5/ground to sensor, set the GPIOs used below Every time the mode changes the 12 V power is recycled to activate the setting Dip-sw 1,2 set sensitivity, Dip-sw 5 sets mode "any rain" or "count buckets" General info: In check for rain mode the signal stays on for an extened period of time ie 30 secs .. several minutes The progam on the RPi will reset the sensor after 30 sec to enable a new rain test During heavy rain and in "High sensitivity" mode the relay clicks ~ twice per sec until count finished ie number of buckets reported
Default pins for dynamic mode: pin 2 +5V to relay board, to run the board pin 8 GPIO14 : 12 V relay #4 pin 10 GPIO15 : dip sw 5 relay #3 pin 12 GPIO18 : dip sw 2 relay #2 pin 14 ground to relay board pin 16 GPIO23 : dip sw 1 relay #1 pin 18 GPIO24 : input = sensor output relay on sensor board; pin 20 ground : input = ... polarity does not matter power supply: +12V -- relay # 4 NC ---- sensor power in; polarity does not matter -12V -------------------- sensor power in; power is delivered when relay is off relay NO # 3 — sw 5 sensor relay NO # 2 — sw 2 sensor relay NO # 1 — sw 1 sensor connect middle of relay(1,2,3) out 1,2,3 to ground on sensor NO = normally open NC = normally closed Static mode ie fixed sensitivity does not require any relays to be setup. any rain mode: switches to drizzel after 10 seconds, to rain after 140 seconds and stays at rain until ~ 140 seconds after last drop High med low sensitive simply count buckets, switch to no rain after xx secs set in parameter

This sensor setup is good to detect pulses into a GPIO: Pulses needs to be > 5 msec in length, max frequency depending on signal is 50-200 Hz use bounceTime and or deadTime to tune for bad signals It will set state count (number of pulses) and lastCountSecs (timestamp) and frequency New pulse is detected under the following conditions: if time between signals > deadTime and bounce time Indigo gets updated if time -lastUpdate > "min secs between indigo updates" In addition you can setup == BURST detection : min y signals in a time window of xx secs, eg min 5 signals in 2 seconds It will set state lastBurstSecs (timestamp) of the last BURST detected == LONGevent detection = continuous movement for xx seconds: eg continuous signals (at least one very 1 second) over a time period of eg 5 seconds It will set state lastLongEventSecs (timestamp) of the last longEvent detected (after 5 seconds of collecting pulses) == CONTINUOSevent detection = requires a pulse every xx seconds(timewindow) to stay UP: eg with pulses every 1 second, timewindow =2 seconds , state will stay UP until pulses stop It will set state lastContinuousEventSecs (-Stop) timestamp of the last continuousEvent start/stop Count and BURST and longEvent continuousEvents are independent of each other You can only use ONE definition of edge per gpio pin (not RISING in one device and FALLING in another for the same pin)

Setup circular clock on neopixel devices. It supports different models, they all need have one or multiple rings with neopixel LEDs The hour/minute/seconds are shown with one or more LEDs on one or multiple rings First define how many rings and number of LED per ring you have Then define which ring(s) should show HH, MM, SS and what color and if it should show 1 or 3 adjacent LED (only if you use 1 ring for that quantity) If you select eg 3 rings for HH (eg rings w 12,24,48 LED) the dots would create a line like the small hand of a clock Then select if you want to put makers on the clock eg at 10/20/30/40/50 minutes in dimm light (set RGB value) You can dimm the light through an action and send it to the device - eg at night
default: pin# 2(+5V), 12(GPIO18 = signal), 6(Gnd). You need to use a level shifter for the signal
